title: Change Directory
description: The 'cd' command is used to change the current directory in the file system.
story: Jerry is hiding in a folder located at '/home/jerry/food/cheese'. Tom needs to use the 'cd' command to navigate to the folder and find Jerry.

game.hint: Try using 'cd' followed by the path where Jerry is hiding.

title: Print Working Directory
description: The 'pwd' command prints the current working directory.
story: Tom wants to know where he is in the file system. Using 'pwd' will tell him his current location.

game.hint: Use 'pwd' to check the current directory.

title: List Files
description: The 'ls' command lists all files and directories in the current directory.
story: Tom wants to see what files are in the current directory. Using 'ls' will list all files and directories.

game.hint: Use 'ls' to list the files in the current directory.

title: Make Directory
description: The 'mkdir' command creates a new directory in the file system.
story: Jerry needs a new hideout, so he creates a directory named 'nest' using 'mkdir'.

game.hint: Use 'mkdir' followed by the directory name to create it.

title: Remove File/Directory
description: The 'rm' command removes files or directories. Use 'rm -r' to remove directories recursively.
story: Tom finds an old cheese file and wants to clean up. He uses 'rm' to remove 'cheese.txt'.

game.hint: Use 'rm' followed by the file name to delete it.

title: Copy Files/Directories
description: The 'cp' command copies files or directories from one location to another.
story: Jerry wants to share a cheese file with Tom, so he uses 'cp' to copy it to Tom's folder.

game.hint: Use 'cp' followed by the source file and destination folder.

title: Move Files/Directories
description: The 'mv' command moves or renames files and directories.
story: Jerry decides to move his cheese file to Tom's folder. He uses 'mv' to transfer it.

game.hint: Use 'mv' followed by the source file and destination folder.

title: Create a New File
description: The 'touch' command creates an empty file or updates the timestamp of an existing file.
story: Jerry needs a new cheese file to store recipes, so he uses 'touch' to create an empty file named 'cheese.txt'.

game.hint: Use 'touch' followed by the file name to create it.

title: Concatenate and Display File Content
description: The 'cat' command displays the content of a file and can concatenate multiple files.
story: Tom wants to read the contents of Jerry's cheese file, so he uses 'cat' to display it.

game.hint: Use 'cat' followed by the file name to view its content.

title: Remove Directory
description: The 'rmdir' command removes empty directories from the file system.
story: Jerry no longer needs his old nest, so he uses 'rmdir' to remove the empty directory.

game.hint: Use 'rmdir' followed by the directory name to remove it.

title: Print Text to Terminal
description: The 'echo' command displays a line of text or a variable value in the terminal.
story: Jerry wants to send a message to Tom. He uses 'echo' to print 'Hello, Tom!' on the screen.

game.hint: Use 'echo' followed by the message you want to display.

title: Display Current User
description: The 'whoami' command displays the current logged-in username.
story: Tom is curious to know who is currently logged in. Using 'whoami', he can find out that it's Jerry.

game.hint: Use 'whoami' to find out the current username.

title: Display System Information
description: The 'uname' command shows basic information about the system. Use 'uname -a' for detailed info.
story: Tom wants to know more about the system he's using. He runs 'uname -a' to get all the details.

game.hint: Use 'uname' with the '-a' option for detailed system info.
